What is the `revokeidentity` command in Verus, and how can I use it to revoke an identity, along with its optional parameters and their effects?

The `revokeidentity` command in Verus is used to revoke an identity on the Verus network. This command can be used to revoke an identity using its name or ID.

The basic syntax of the command is `revokeidentity "nameorID"`. This will revoke the specified identity and broadcast the transaction to the network.

However, there are several optional parameters that can be used to customize the behavior of the command:

* `returntx`: This is a boolean parameter that defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, the command will sign the transaction with the wallet's private key and return the transaction instead of broadcasting it to the network.
* `tokenrevoke`: This is a boolean parameter that defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, the command will use the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, to revoke the identity.
* `feeoffer`: This is a value parameter that allows you to specify a non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction.
* `sourceoffunds`: This is a string parameter that allows you to specify a transparent or private address to source all funds for fees, which can help preserve the privacy of the identity.

Here are some examples of how to use the `revokeidentity` command:

* `verus revokeidentity "nameorID"`: This will revoke the specified identity and broadcast the transaction to the network.
* `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`: This will revoke the specified identity using the Verus JSON-RPC API.

In summary, the `revokeidentity` command is used to revoke an identity on the Verus network, and can be customized using optional parameters to control the behavior of the command.

revokeidentity "nameorID" (returntx) (tokenrevoke) (feeoffer) (sourceoffunds)

Arguments
    "returntx"            (bool,  optional) defaults to false and transaction is sent, if true, transaction is signed by this wallet and returned
    "tokenrevoke"           (bool,  optional) defaults to false, if true, the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, will be used to revoke
    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction
    "sourceoffunds"          (string, optional) transparent or private address to source all funds for fees to preserve privacy of the identity

Result:

Examples:
> verus revokeidentity "nameorID"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "revokeidentity", "params": ["nameorID"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
